objective: Interpret a multiplication equation as a comparison.
core_steps: Introduce multiplication as a comparison using real-world examples (e.g., '8 is 2 times as many as 4').
Translate verbal statements into multiplication equations.
Use tape diagrams and number sentences to represent multiplicative comparisons.
Reinforce the idea that multiplication compares quantities using 'times as many' language.
Engage in guided practice with comparative situations (e.g., using diagrams and word problems).
